title: Bitcoin Dips, Then Bounces After ETF Approval While Ethereum Tops $2,500
description: Bitcoin's price action has been choppy since the SEC officially approved spot ETFs in the United States, while Ethereum hit an 18-month high.

title: Bitcoin ETFs Granted SEC Approval in Historic Action
description: After more than a decade of rejections, the SEC has at last given its blessing to allow Bitcoin ETFs to begin trading in the U.S.

title: Twitter Gives Up on NFT Profile Pics, Killing Ethereum Feature for Paying Users
description: Two years after letting subscribers equip owned NFTs, Elon Musk’s Twitter (aka X) has axed the feature for subscribers.

title: Why is Bitcoin price volatile today?
description:
Bitcoin price continues to whipsaw even after the SEC approved all 11 spot Bitcoin ETF applications.

On Jan. 10, the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) finally approved all of the spot Bitcoin ETF applications. Similar to the price whipsaws seen from BTC on Jan. 9 after an erroneous approval tweet  from the regulator, BTC price is showing volatility today.

Earlier in the day, a fresh round of filings suggested that the ETFs would be approved and Bitcoin price reacted by rallying to $46,437. Investor sentiment was further boosted by the Cboe approving listings. 

The market has benefitted from the expectation of a spot BTC ETF approval, but there are still traders who anticipate the approval to be a buy-the-rumor, sell-the-news-style event, and some believe that approval will fail to send Bitcoin price above $48,000.

Read more

title: Spot Bitcoin ETF approvals: reporting live
description:
The long-awaited decision on spot Bitcoin ETFs has finally come, and Cointelegraph is here to keep you updated on all the latest developments following this groundbreaking development.

4:35 pm EST: The Cointelegraph live YouTube stream is beginning right now. Head on over and catch up with Robert and Giovanni on all the developments live and in colour!

4:30 pm EST: We have our first reactions to the news, from Bloomberg stalwarts Eric Balchunas and James Seyffart.

4:20 pm EST: Good morning, good afternoon or good evening wherever you are! The news is out, spot bitcoin ETFs have been approved by the SEC, and Cointelegraph is here to keep you up-to-date on all the latest news and comments as this story develops. Stay with us over the coming hours as we provide a live blog 

Read more

title: SEC approves spot Bitcoin ETFs after 11 years of rejections
description:
The U.S. SEC has officially approved the first spot Bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs) after 11 years of rejecting such products, according to a Jan. 10 regulatory filing. The first spot Bitcoin ETF application was filed in 2013, and the SEC rejected every subsequent proposal due to various concerns related to financial stability and market integrity. […]

The post SEC approves spot Bitcoin ETFs after 11 years of rejections appeared first on CryptoSlate.

title: Mass Approvals: SEC Green-Lights 11 Spot Bitcoin ETFs
description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has approved 11 spot bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs) for listing and trading on U.S. stock exchanges. In a historic move after years of anticipation and regulatory hurdles, the approved spot bitcoin ETFs are expected to start trading Thursday on NYSE Arca, Nasdaq, and Cboe BZX Exchange. title: CoinGecko’s X accounts breached by hackers
description: Cryptocurrency aggregator CoinGecko faces a security breach as X accounts @CoinGecko and @GeckoTerminal are compromised; users cautioned against interaction.

title: Ripple Labs plans to repurchase $285m stake in tender offer
description: Ripple Labs initiated a $285 million share buyback, valuing the company at $11.3 billion, amid regulatory uncertainties.

title: SEC approves spot Bitcoin ETF on accelerated basis
description: The United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) approved multiple spot Bitcoin ETFs on Jan. 10. According to an official SEC filing, spot Bitcoin ETFs have been approved for listing on all registered national exchanges in the U.S., including the…

title: BREAKING: SEC Approves All 11 Spot Bitcoin ETFs, BTC Price Holds Steady At $46,000
description: In a groundbreaking development for the cryptocurrency and Bitcoin market, the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has approved all 11 spot Bitcoin ETFs submitted by the world’s largest asset managers.  Bitcoin ETFs Align With Exchange Act Standards In its official filing, the SEC stated that each proposal sought to list and trade shares of a trust that would hold spot Bitcoin, either wholly or partially.  Related Reading: Crypto Payments Soared To Unprecedented Levels In 2023, CoinGate Report Reveals Importantly, the commission found that the proposals were consistent with the provisions of the Exchange Act and the applicable rules and regulations governing national securities exchanges.  Specifically, the SEC determined that the proposals adhere to the requirements outlined in Section 6(b)(5) of the Exchange Act, which includes preventing fraudulent and manipulative acts and practices to protect investors and the public interest. The approval of these Bitcoin ETFs marks an important milestone in the maturation of the cryptocurrency market.  However, despite the significant news, the Bitcoin price has remained stable at the $46,200 level, defying some expectations of immediate price surges following the SEC’s decision.  Nevertheless, it is important to note that the true impact of these index funds is anticipated to unfold over the coming years, once institutions and retail investors fully enter the market. New Era For Bitcoin According to the official filing, trading for the approved Bitcoin ETFs is scheduled to commence tomorrow, enabling market participants to gain exposure to Bitcoin through regulated and traditional investment vehicles.  The introduction of these Bitcoin ETFs is expected to attract a broader range of investors, including institutional players, and contribute to increased liquidity and market efficiency. Related Reading: Renowned Finance Author Says Bitcoin Price Is Headed For $150,000, Reveals Catalyst Ultimately, as institutional and retail investor participation grows, the Bitcoin market is poised for significant developments and further mainstream adoption.  The approval of these ETFs represents a pivotal moment in the ongoing integration of cryptocurrencies into the traditional financial system. It sets the stage for future growth, innovation, and the potential for broader acceptance of digital assets in the investment landscape. Featured image from Shutterstock, chart from TradingView.com

title: SEC Approves Highly Anticipated Bitcoin ETFs in Historic Move, Creating First-Ever Pipeline Between Wall Street and Crypto
description:
The US Securities and Exchange Commission has approved several spot Bitcoin ETFs in a historic move that creates a monetary pipeline between Wall Street and the king of cryptocurrency. The announcement comes amid a volatile day for BTC, which is trading at $45,937 at time of publishing, down 0.9% in the last 24 hours. The SEC’s […]
